Method Detail

commitAll

public GitCommitResponseImpl commitAll(java.io.File repository,
                                       java.lang.String message)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitCommit
Automatically stage all tracked files that have been changed and then commit all files staged in the git repository's index.

Specified by:
commitAll in interface IGitCommit
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to commit against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
message - The message to attach to the commit. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

Description copied from interface: IGitCommit
Commits staged changes into the specified repository. The specific files that are committed depends on the options specified.

This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options to commit with.

commit

public GitCommitResponseImpl commit(java.io.File repository,
                                    GitCommitOptions options,
                                    java.lang.String message,
                                    java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitCommit
Commits staged changes into the specified repository. The specific files that are committed depends on the options and paths specified.

Specified by:
commit in interface IGitCommit
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to commit against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options to commit with.
message - The message to attach to the commit. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
paths - A list of folders and/or files to commit. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-null and non-empty list is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results from the commit.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

Throws:

  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

commitOnly

public GitCommitResponseImpl commitOnly(java.io.File repository,
                                        java.lang.String message,
                                        java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitCommit
Commits only the changes in the specified paths into the specified repository. Any staged changes (changes already defined in the index) are ignored.

Specified by:
commitOnly in interface IGitCommit
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to commit against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
message - The message to attach to the commit. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
paths - A list of folders and/or files to commit. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-null and non-empty list is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results from the commit.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

commitProcessor

protected GitCommitResponseImpl commitProcessor(java.io.File repository,
                                                GitCommitOptions options,
                                                java.lang.String message,
                                                java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                JavaGitException
Processes the commit.

Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to commit against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options to commit with.
message - The message to attach to the commit. A non-zero length argument is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
paths - A list of folders and/or files to commit. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath().
Returns:
The results from the commit.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

buildCommand

protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildCommand(GitCommitOptions options,
                                                        java.lang.String message,
                                                        java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
Builds a list of command arguments to pass to ProcessBuilder.

Parameters:
options - The options to include on the command line.
message - The message for the commit.
Returns:
A list of the individual arguments to pass to ProcessBuilder.
